name: Service Mesh Outage Cascade
description: Istio service mesh failure causing microservice communication failures across multiple Kubernetes clusters. Senior SRE Engineer Kevin Martinez (kevin.martinez@bigpanda.com) from infrastructure team diagnosed control plane instability during rolling deployment executed by Platform Engineer Rachel Kim (rachel.kim@bigpanda.com). Customer-facing applications affected including enterprise client director Stephen Park (stephen.park@enterprise.bigpanda.net) unable to access dashboard analytics during critical business reporting period.

business_impact.summary: Enterprise customer analytics service unavailable during peak reporting
business_impact.revenue_impact: potential revenue loss from enterprise tier

root_cause: Istio control plane instability during rolling deployment causing service mesh communication failures
resolution_summary: Rolled back Istio deployment, restarted control plane components, and restored service mesh connectivity
lessons_learned: Service mesh deployments require extensive testing
Control plane instability can cascade across clusters
Better monitoring needed for service mesh health

name: Elasticsearch Cluster Shard Relocation
description: Automated shard relocation process failed causing data inconsistency across Elasticsearch cluster nodes affecting search and analytics workloads. Data Platform Engineer Jennifer Chen (jennifer.chen@bigpanda.com) diagnosed shard allocation failures during node maintenance coordinated with Database Administrator Derek Park (derek.park@bigpanda.com). Customer search functionality impacted for e-commerce client VP Analytics Lisa Thompson (lisa.thompson@commerce.bigpanda.net) during peak shopping season.

alerts.summary: Cluster health degraded - shard allocation failures

business_impact.summary: Search and analytics functionality degraded during peak e-commerce traffic
business_impact.revenue_impact: potential sales impact due to degraded search experience

root_cause: Node maintenance procedure triggered automatic shard relocation which failed due to insufficient disk space on target nodes
resolution_summary: Manually completed shard redistribution and optimized disk usage patterns
lessons_learned: Automated shard relocation requires disk space validation
Cluster health monitoring needs real-time shard allocation tracking

name: Database Connection Pool Exhaustion
description: Customer portal authentication failures due to PostgreSQL connection pool exhaustion during peak concurrent user sessions. Platform Engineer Michael Rodriguez (michael.rodriguez@bigpanda.com) from core services team identified connection leak in recent feature deployment by software engineer Emily Davis (emily.davis@bigpanda.com). Customer login attempts failed affecting enterprise security manager Cynthia Wilson (cynthia.wilson@security.bigpanda.net) and her team members during authentication testing.

business_impact.summary: Customer portal authentication failures affecting enterprise customer access
business_impact.revenue_impact: potential customer acquisition impact from authentication failures
business_impact.reputation_impact: enterprise customer security team unable to access platform

root_cause: Recent feature deployment introduced connection leak in authentication service causing pool exhaustion
resolution_summary: Rolled back problematic deployment and increased connection pool limits temporarily
lessons_learned: Authentication failures have immediate customer impact

action_items.title: Fix connection leak in authentication service

name: Redis Sentinel Failover
description: Redis primary node failure triggered automatic failover but caused data inconsistency during replica promotion process. Senior Cache Engineer James Park (james.park@bigpanda.com) and Data Infrastructure architect Sarah Liu (sarah.liu@bigpanda.com) coordinated recovery efforts affecting session cache and real-time analytics workloads. Customer dashboard updates delayed for enterprise account manager Rebecca Chen (rebecca.chen@enterprise.bigpanda.com) during strategic planning session.

alerts.summary: Cache hit rate degradation during replica promotion

business_impact.summary: Customer dashboard updates delayed during enterprise strategic planning

root_cause: Redis primary node hardware failure triggered automatic failover but replica promotion caused temporary data inconsistency
resolution_summary: Completed failover process, validated data consistency, and restored cache performance
lessons_learned: Data consistency validation required during replica promotion
Cache monitoring needs failover state tracking

name: Kubernetes Node Resource Saturation
description: Worker node CPU exhaustion causing pod scheduling failures and service degradation across multiple namespaces. Kubernetes Cluster Manager David Kim (david.kim@bigpanda.com) scaled cluster capacity while incident commander Jennifer White (jennifer.white@bigpanda.com) coordinated workload rebalancing. Node resource monitoring failed to predict saturation threshold for data processing workloads managed by analytics engineer Austin Wilson (austin.wilson@bigpanda.com).

alerts.summary: Pod scheduling failures due to insufficient resources

business_impact.summary: Data processing workloads delayed affecting analytics pipeline performance

root_cause: Sudden increase in data processing workload exceeded auto-scaling thresholds causing node resource saturation
resolution_summary: Scared cluster capacity and optimized workload distribution
lessons_learned: Auto-scaling thresholds need adjustment for data workloads
Resource monitoring needs predictive capacity planning
